block.p: Stephanie Alston and Michael Nero are to be married in Manhattan this morning at the Conservatory Garden in Central Park. The Rev. Gary Gibbs, an American Baptist minister, is to perform the nondenominational ceremony.

The bride, 45, will take the name Alston-Nero. She is a freelance consultant who runs theater education programs for schoolchildren, most recently on behalf of the Theater Development Fund, the nonprofit service organization for the performing arts. She is also an actress, who was in the cast of ''Sheila's Day,'' a play about African-American and South African women struggling against racial oppression that appeared at the Crossroads Theater Company in New Brunswick, N.J., and the New Victory Theater in Manhattan; it also toured in South Africa. She graduated from Antioch College. The bride is a daughter of Margaret Morris of Philadelphia and Harvey R. Alston of Virginia Beach, and a stepdaughter of John Morris.

The bridegroom, 47, will also change his surname to Alston-Nero. He is a mechanical engineer in Sunnyside, Queens, for the building and bridges department of Amtrak. He also owns Front Row Productions, a Manhattan company that produces episodes for ''Artist Spotlight,'' a series on Queens Public Television, a public access cable station.
He is a son of Gloria Nero of Jamaica, Queens, and the late Raymond Nero. The bridegroom's previous marriage ended in divorce.
